subject: p18417750
History: History of heart failure, now with shortness of breath evaluate for acute process.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest. The lungs are clear without focal consolidation. No pneumothorax or pleural effusion is seen. There is mild atelectasis seen at the right lung base. A left-sided pacer is present with wires terminating in the right atrium and right ventricle. Again noted is a metallic stent projecting over the expected location of the aortic valve. Hardware is in the lower thoracic spine with evidence of vertebroplasty. The heart size is enlarged but unchanged. An unchanged wedge deformity is seen superior to the vertebroplasty.
Impression: Stable cardiomegaly without findings of failure. No acute intrathoracic process.
